Annotation#

In this section, we will adapt the annotation pipeline from scHarmonization [Steuernagel et al., 2022] to our data. You can just run this pipeline directly. Here, I just break down the pipeline into several steps for better understanding.

annotation

  • Step 0 : Leiden Clustering in Mesenchyme
  • Step 1: Choose the optimal cluster levels
    • Introduction
    • Process
  • Step 2: MRTree
    • Introduction
    • Input
    • Output
    • Script
  • Step 3: Marker Detection
    • Introduction
    • Input
    • Output
    • Script
  • Step 4: Prune Tree
    • Introduction
    • Input
    • Output

Details of Each Level Annotation#

In this section, we explain the details of each level annotation. You can explore the marker genes of each cluster in the shiny app.

Cluster details

  • Level 1 Annotation
    • Motivation
    • Embryonic Mesenchyme
    • Postnatal Mesenchyme
  • Level 2 annotation
    • Motivation
    • Bud Mesenchyme & Cap Mesenchyme
    • Apical pulp & Distal pulp
    • Odontoblast
    • Chondrocyte
    • Epithelium-like
    • Stress-related
    • Low quality
  • Level 3 Annotation
    • Motivation
    • Osteoblast
    • Cementoblast
    • Pre-odontoblast
    • Coronal Papilla
    • Kit+ Papilla
    • Cycling Mesenchyme
    • C1qtnf3+ Mesenchyme
    • Tfap2b+ Mesenchyme, Hic1+ Mesenchyme, Pax3+ Mesenchyme
    • High-Mito
    • Low Quality 2
  • Level 4 annotation
  • Level 5 annotation
